item.title: GirlswithDeepPockets.com
item.description: Ok, this post is about one of my latest crazy/harebrained/whacky ideas. I’m fed up of having to carry my Galaxy Note 3 in my hand. I can’t stand handbags and most women’s clothing items don’t have pockets or the pockets are insufficient. Given how easy it is to build a website these days, I thought I’d become a sofa warrior for the campaign for pockets. I’ve made a site and aim to make it an open & technical backend.

item.title: DeployR â€“ why Microsoft bought Revolution?
item.description: I’ve been asked by a few people recently about why I don’t use Azure Machine Learning (ML). I answer that I don’t use it yet, and the reason being that at the moment the robust development life-cycle isn’t in place around it. I think that will change – one of the great reasons for the acquisition of Revolution Analytics (in my opinion) is their DeployR system. DeployR is essentially an R web service platform.
